text: Very nice independent coffee shop with good coffee (especially their single origin) and very good in-house baked goods.  Nice place to work from for a few hours as well.

I love this place! Not only is it different from the Starbucks of the world because it is local, great decor, local art on the walls (I could keep going), but it is really, REALLY good! I hate only having soy milk as a dairy alternative other coffee shops. Echo has many more - almond milk is my favorite. Pastries are delicious too! Haven't had any salads or sandwiches yet, but that is my next on my list.

Went to Echo coffee for the first time today on the recommendation of a friend. The service was good, the coffee tasted good. However when I went to the ladies bathroom I was so disgusted by the filthy bathroom that I will not be going back for second time. If I'm going to spend $3.00 or more on a cup of coffee, I will go somewhere where the bathroom doesn't look like a dirty highway service station bathroom.

For being a local business that just recently opened, Echo Coffee is doing a phenomenal job. I have had nothing but great experiences (and none of the snafus that tend to plague small businesses when they first open). 

First, their space is fantastic. It is a clean, open and very modern buildout that manages to feel warm and inviting. The service is prompt, efficient and professional. And finally, the coffee is excellent; each drink has been consistent in flavor and quality. For a nice vacation from daily life, step into Echo Coffee with a book.

Echo is a nice little shop that i frequent from time to time when i'm in that neck of the woods. FIrst time i checked in it was too hot for coffee and ordered iced tea. Awesome Iced Tea! Vibe is great and i have been comfortable every visit. My only issue with Echo is that i just don't enjoy their coffee that much. Have tried multiple times hoping that it was just a fluke, but 2 days ago got the worst one yet. Sadly, that will be the last time i try ordering coffee. 
I will visit Echo again (iced tea only) and like i said i enjoy the place overall, but wish the coffee was better.

Great coffee!!!!!! went before going out to dinner and almost miss our reservation time because we were enjoying ourselves so much. The coffee is smooth....no bitter taste here. The little butter cookies are to die for : ) .Planning on visiting again this morning.
I am digging Echo...delicious Espresso and free wifi!

Checked it out with a friend. Nice quite place. Super fast wifi. Cool front staff. Great coffee. It's pretty big in there and they have couches in the back. Great selection of music to go with everything.

Wow wow wow! I was waiting for a movie at Camelview with a friend and we wanted a place to hang out for a while, so I found this place on Yelp about a week after it had opened. I am personally a sucker for fancy designs in my latte foam, but the coffee at Echo is delicious as well as pretty. Even better is the ambience. The music is perfect-- mellow indie tunes at just the right volume for studying or socializing (so many coffee shops don't get this right!). The staff were all very friendly and my barista was eager to help me select the perfect drink. Anyway, if I lived closer I'm sure I would patronize this place at least a few times a week. As it is, I try to stop by whenever I'm in the area.

I enjoy this little coffee shop right across the street from our house. My husband and I come here (almost daily) for our coffee fix. We like the seating, staff, El Salvador espresso and last but not least Steve! Steve Belt (owner) is such a great guy, very accommodating with our monthly PR meeting/group as well.

If you need a quick coffee fix or a place to work (free wifi), try this place! Quality service and drinks!

This is a great local coffee shop to spend the day doing work or homework & fast wifi. Nice section of couches if you want to just relax. Drip coffee & espresso are excellent. Pastries are pretty good, wish they had some more food options. Great atmosphere & friendly baristas to chat with especially the tall lady..Gabby? Can't remember her name but she's helpful & sweet. It's also very clean & modern. Music is always at appropriate level which is nice when you are trying to study or work.
Tea is good, space is simple, food delicious, service friendly, wifi reliable

Great coffee shop featuring:

- tasty espresso - beans roasted on site
- ample parking
- ample seating, indoor and out
- free wifi - password 'titusblend'
- good music, and not so loud it keeps you from concentrating
- friendly staff
- open until 10
- food menu but sandwiches only served until 3 - after that it's pastries, cookies, etc.  (also a pizza place a few doors away.)
- not all tables have access to electric
- no live entertainment that I've seen, though they have held a barista contest and another event featuring Walter, the world's largest VW bus.
Really great coffee!! They have almond milk for my mocha which is a gigantic bonus! Wish the seating was a bit more comfy.

Good studying atmosphere, comfy couches, and equally amazing coffee. They have plenty of seating available if you need a place to work or study. Inviting atmosphere and all around relaxing. The indie/acoustic music fits the atmosphere and adds additional character.
I love this place so much that I'm [mostly] able to overlook the snobby attitude of the employees.

I've been sniffing around echo for awhile, have had some good (mostly in the evening) experiences but mostly bad vibes. Morning staff, (2 girls usually) makes one want to smash their head on a tree rather than try to communicate with either of them. Feels like a half-assed organic coffee shop. It's 2017, all milk and alternatives can be 100% organic, especially since they "claim" organic. Truth forever.

I visited Echo for the first time today. I liked it. The interior looks a lot like a big name coffee chain (which shall remain nameless) but is nicer. Echo has a variety of seating (chairs, tables, couches, benches, patio, etc.) and is more roomy than the "nameless" chain. I ate a very tasty chocolate chip scone with my espresso. I seldom eat scones or drink espresso, but both were excellent - the espresso in particluar, which was very strong and quite freshly ground. I would definitely return if in the neighborhood, but would be more likely to order the chai, as I vastly prefer tea over coffee. Staff was very pleasant and the shop was clean. Would have given 4.5 stars if that was an option. Recommended for anyone who would like to break through the corporate rut; Echo has all the quality of same, with none of the socioeconomic baggage.

Nice staff, good service, good atmosphere.  But the internet service sucks...you get bounced off all the time.  Also, the men's room is disgusting.  I don't think it's been cleaned in months and smells like a nasty back ally.  The urinal is out of order and has been for months.   I suspect the lack of cleanliness extends to behind the counter and the kitchen.  These are management issues, not staff issues.  Whoever runs this place ought to be replaced.

I come in here from time to time to get a fresh cup of coffee. I love that the staff knows everything that they are serving and where it is from. I just find that the place is a little quite from time to time. Some music on the patio would be great. But that is my little gripe for this place otherwise it is perfect in every other way.

Have happened upon this place a few times while on bike rides with friends. Always enjoy the atmosphere, the staff and the DELICIOUS food. Was excited to find a local coffee shop;  as we are always looking for alternatives.

Would suggest for a great date night, a place to stop for a quick cup, or a relaxing night of conversation.

This place is great! I am big on customer service especially in places like Scottsdale where I have heard not a lot of good things. But this place is far from those negative comments! The morning staff is friendly and the customer service is excellent! The coffee shop is laid back; music is not too loud; noise level is moderate; and their wide windows create an open atmosphere. It's a great a great place for studying, catching up with friends, small meetings, and internet surfing. Unlike those other dark dim loud coffee shops. Echo coffee is a great place with great staff and great tasting coffee and espressos. Come see for your self.

Most amazing coffee. Steve the owner is very knowledgable in all things coffee and it shows in every cup of coffee. I love a cappuccino, an almond milk latte or a glass of their cold brew. They also have great pastries, my favorite is the blueberry muffin.
Awkward vibe! Not to friendly customer service either. I waited 10 minutes for just a regular coffee. It's like all the staff had no communication. Food is pretty good.
My second office!! Great place to get some work done and their coffee is amazing!! Specially cappuccino.

So here is the deal with Echo,
Their coffee is great. However the baked goods are sparse and very overpriced just like the whole beans that he sales. Point is that yes, there are much superior beans offered here in AZ. My two favorites are Single Speed Roasters and  Cortez Coffee , Cartel is awesome As well. The best part is they don't overcharge! Look, I love my whole beans from local roaster. I even buy beans from roasters in CA. When on surfing trips.  Sorry to say the vibe can suck like most of the so called art on the wall. But, for a good cap and a random overpriced treat it fits the bill. FYI: don't bother asking the owner for much in the way of info. He thinks his place is a God send to us local coffee and treat lovers, however he misses the big picture of what it takes to be a true mecca for those who seek quality, flavor and culture all in the name of coffee. Perhaps a bit of focus on the culture that is catered to would render a "For Profit" establishment rather than scratching at the surface of identity and success.

The sandwiches here are really, really good. Sometimes I find myself in a coffee shop or lunch place that has a  salads/sandwich/soup based menu and find myself trying to figure out why more places don't try to be a little more original in their offerings. Echo Coffee has a couple great cold sandwiches and a couple great hot ones, and their pastries are all good too. Their lattes are smooth and perfect and float down your throat at just the right temperature. These people take coffee seriously and clearly love what they do, and it shows.
I got a latte...SUPER strong, but it was good. The employees were nice and quick witted. Really quick service and pretty comfortable setting.

In the midst of the ubiquitousness of a Starbucks in every corner , it's nice that we do have coffee shops in our city with good coffee, a nice place to hang out with friends or alone with a book or laptop.It has both indoor and outdoor seating . Food selection could've been bigger. Still, all said and done ,  I hope we had more places like this in Scottsdale.
Great coffee, terrible music..and it would be nice if they charged less for refills, like every single other coffee shop in town does.
Echo is a very friendly and relaxing place.  The staff is very helpful and both the food and coffee are excellent.  I strongly recommend this restaurant.

plenty of potential, but untrained staff on bar delivering sub-par quality. 
the roast looked good in the hopper and a Dietrich sitting in the back of the shop looked at up to deliver an excellent experience. we ordered a shot, cappuccino and a pourover. the shot was unpalatable; very over extracted and ashy, the same with the cap but buried in milk, and the poor over (auto correct knows what's up) was so under extracted it barely looked like dirty water, nevermind the taste. We returned the drinks and asked for them to be corrected, but a quick conversation with the batista made it clear she isn't being equipped to understand and deliver specialty coffee. disappointed.

Want to wait 30 minutes for a latte? Then this is your spot. One guy working and he was the slowest barista I've ever seen. I would've cancelled our order and left but my bf is a coffee addict so we waited. And waited. Nice atmosphere but not the greatest service. This is my first time here and based on the snail like service, I would not come back. 1 person working on a Sunday afternoon? Not sure what they were thinking

LOVE, LOVE THE FACT THAT ECHO HAS GREAT TASTING ESPRESSO'S AND THAT THE BEANS AND MILK OPTIONS ARE ALL ORGANIC!!!  BEANS - FAIR TRADE.
HARD TO FIND COFFEE/FOOD BUSINESSES THAT "GET" HOW IMPORTANT "ORGANIC" IS - with respect to flavor, health, the environment, etc...
COOL - they roast their own beans at the back of store - super fresh.
COOL - their baker makes awesome treats though, the gluten-free options are sparse (2 granola bar items).
COOL - location central.
COOL - very friendly & knowledgeable staff

NEW EXPERIENCE - barista "Trevor", I think that was his name, made an absolutely gorgeous latte art design - a swan with a heart face and swirling waters below - amazing!!!  Will try to post the photos later.

This is where I go to study or use the wifi. The music is not super loud and every one seems really chill. I'm not a huge coffee drinker. I usually just get an iced tea, but it's good. I come here like every other week or once a week to get stuff done!

This coffee spot is really close to where I live and I only stop here when I am pressed for time or don't feel like driving to places that I prefer. 

The coffee is decent and their menu is simple. Sometimes the latte will be too milky and the coffee flavor does not shine through, but the buzz is strong enough. If you order your drink to stay they give you a little short bread that is nice and buttery. They also have a clean food selection and multiple baked items that are quite good. It does have a good atmosphere for studying as well and the music selection is usually decent. 

At this point you are probably wondering why three starts only? My biggest issue is with the service. The girls working the front are nothing but unfriendly. I often feel like I am a hassle and wonder why they appear to hate their job. I wouldn't highly recommend it, but I also wouldn't say to absolutely avoid Echo either.

Great neighborhood coffee shop.  This place serves great coffee and food that is inviting for any person...meaning, you don't have to be a hipster to sit and enjoy a cup at this place.  Also the prices are much cheaper than the Starbucks down the road, and are of a much higher quality.  Definitely recommend this place if you are looking for a place to study or grab a quick coffee on the go.  The lattes are great!

My coffee was good but the attitudes from the baristas left a bad taste in my mouth. Maybe it's the hipster attitude but no hello, nothing...just a rude attitude overall. It was my first time coming here and I won't be back, I'd rather go somewhere where i didn't feel like I was putting someone out by ordering a coffee.
Second favorite coffee shop in the entire valley, and only second favorite because of the distance from my house. This is my go to spot for coffee when at my office. great prople, great atmosphere.
I really like to go to Echo Coffee. It is a great place to get your caffeine fix and work. I've never felt more productive!

The espresso is the best I have found recently! I absolutely love the atmosphere and the baristas remember my order after only a few times of going there! They have great pricing and a bunch of different milk alternatives. I would highly recommend the americano and or latte with coconut milk.

Love this place. It has a cool coffee shop vibe, plenty of tables, comfy couches and chairs and a bar kind of area.  They've always been super cool and friendly.  Also, they have lots of creamer options including soy, almond, and rice milk!

I've been there 5 times, usually stopping in on a weeknight after work, but once I stopped in mid-day during the week and the owner made it a point to say say Hello and ask how I found out about them.  He was very energetic, positive and seemed like the kind of person who really cares about his business and his customers.

Been to this place 3 times now. Today was the first time I tried their food. My order consisted of a skim latte and their Italian press sandwich. First the coffee, and i say coffee because the latte actually tasted like coffee. Unlike other coffee joints, ahem Starbucks, this actually tasted like their was more to this drink than sugar and milk. Solid drink. 

Second the sandwich. Wow. It was awesome. It had the perfect ratio of meat on it so it wasn't huge but still very filling. The bread was awesome, grilled and crispy but not rock hard like panani presses can sometimes cause. Overall I was very satisfied with it, I will be back to try some of their other sandwiches. The only reason I don't give this place a 5 star is the prices, its not cheap but then again like most yelpers I don't mind paying extra if it supports a local joint.
Great atmosphere and delicious coffee. I drink decaf and their slow drip process enhances the bold coffee flavors. Be patient as it wasn't immediate gratifications like other coffee shops.

Decent place with relaxing, quiet music and a nice calm vibe. The lighting is dim, which I actually really liked. We had some hibiscus herbal tea, and it was pretty tasty! Each drink comes with a little cookie, which is cool if you like free cookies. 

My brother asked if they had any yerba mate and the barista guy looked so confused. He did not seem knowledgeable regarding the menu. He was decently friendly I guess, but he seemed to have an indifferent attitude and was not terribly helpful.

The second time we ordered tea he asked my brother to bring up our ceramic mugs. I thought that was slightly odd. I figured he would just come and grab them, seeing as the cafe was not terribly busy. When he brought the second round of tea to our table, he seemed annoyed. 

Echo Coffee has potential for sure, but as others have stated PLEASE train your staff! I thought maybe I had come on an off day, but it seems like poor service is the norm. If there was a little more effort, eye contact, and smiling I would be far more likely to return! Nice, friendly, helpful staff would be a game-changer for Echo.

Beautiful setting, great ambiance, excellent coffee.  They are open until 10pm, have WIFI and a lot of people.  I loved my mocha.  All their drinks are excellent. Great place to hang out on the weekends. Will be back!
good coffee, fair prices, great studying ambience and an overall quiet, clean place. if you're trying to socialize, this might not be the best place but for studying, it's my first choice.

I really like this place overall but a couple of the baristas bother me enough that I avoid coming very often. (There is also a very sweet, cheerful girl who works hard and because of her I feel bad writing this review). One female barista has been repeatedly rude to me and to the people around me. She seems to be friendly only to male guests. Another female barista talks loudly and continually... to the point where I stopped trying to study in order to write this review. If these 2 employees (who seem to be there all the time) would improve their work ethic and awareness of their surroundings I would love Echo, because the coffee is great, the music is good, and there is usually plenty of seating. But in the end, I dont enjoy feeling uncomfortable and irritated in a place meant for enjoyment.

Nice place to work and hang.  Really great espresso drinks, although I don't like the pour-over as much as Cartel's.  Cartel's is less bitter and more floral tasting.  Their oatmeal cookies are good, but not a fan of their food as of late.  Not enough vegetarian or smaller options.  Soup, half-sandwich or half-salad would be nice.  Overpriced, too - a very limited, plain salad (Waldorf) for 7.50.  And that's one of the cheaper things.  No more Cuban sandwich, either.  And oddly enough, the sandwiches come with a little bucket of stale popcorn.  Tastes terrible, and in any case, does not go with coffee at all.  The chef can obviously do pastries - it would be great if he tried his hand at some savory muffins like they have in New Zealand coffee shops (sweet potato, cheese and spinach; bacon and cheese, etc.).
Best iced latte I've ever had...even with almond milk, the espresso is smooth, sweet, low acidity! Delicious!

I know for a fact that all pastries and food are made with all natural or organic ingredients and are made in house fresh every day.  as for the baristas they are all quite knowledgeable and professional in their craft. I love this place.

The cafe looks nice, and is comfortable for enjoying coffee and getting work done. The morning staff doesn't have much personality but the afternoon staff is really nice. The coffee is decent. I haven't tried many of the pastries, but the few I have tried don't have much flavor. No other food is offered here which is kind of a downer.
Great coffee shop! Fairly quiet with lots of tables and space for studying. There are also couches in the back to relax on.
Good coffee, stable internet - Nice staff though "New age" "good energy"  and astrology vibe and talk is staple of conversation. Several Power outlets.
The best coffee shop I've ever been to.... the coffee, the people and the atmosphere is great... Free wifi... great location... 5 stars!!
Always pleased, never disappointed!! Best chai and latte in town! And wonderful place to sit and visit, quaint and quiet. Love the atmosphere!

I've been making an effort to explore more coffee shops in the Tempe area to study. I found this place after a few study-friendly reviews.

The shop itself is pretty spacious, a good deal of tables, wifi, and a slew of couches to make yourself comfortable and grade papers, do homework, keep up with your wordpress/squarespace, etc. (Yeah, it's a hip place.) They also have a few art pieces from local artists which I appreciate.

I arrived on a Saturday afternoon and there weren't too many people inside. The baristas didn't greet customers, which I thought was a little weird. He just stared at me. It was a little awkward. We'll chalk it up to him being an introvert like me.

But sheesh was that latte good. The roast is impressive- not too acidic, and the temperature wasn't scalding hot. Some may argue that the price was a little steep for a latte, but I reason that it's because it's some primo roast. In addition they have a lot of non-dairy options which I loved. Soy milk, almond milk, even rice milk. 

All in all- good coffee, study-friendly. Will definitely come again.

Echo has always been my go-to for 2 things: coffee and a great study atmosphere. The coffee is such an awesome quality that I can taste it with every sip. I truly have never tried something I don't like - although I normally stick to lattes. As far as the atmosphere, the place gives off an incredible ambiance and makes me feel inclined to study. Although it's not always quiet, it somehow works so well for me. Maybe the coffee has a crazy ingredient ;). 

So why 4 stars? The staff. Don't get me wrong, they are barista wizards. They know how to make coffee and make it well. But, wow. Could they hate people more? They always give off a vibe that they 1) don't want to be there and 2) don't want you to be there either. I'm a regular enough to notice some do this more than others (there's a young, tall guy that is always super friendly!). 

Anyways- other than a lack of feeling genuine hospitality from some staff, you should go here. Everything else will outweigh that one negative. Cheers to good coffee.

Let's just say I've also had a few CAPPUCCINOS here at Echo, and if anyone thinks they could get a better one at Coffee Bean and Tea Leaf, they should probably go have their taste buds examined by a medical professional. Freshly roasted, quality beans, excellent customer service, award winning latte artistry and a high standard for craftsmanship and technique make Echo stand out amongst a sea of fast-food caliber shops in the valley. Coffee Bean and Tea Leaf??? ... go back home and pop a K-Cup!

What can I say about Echo Cofffee that hasn't already been said?  I am a  frequent customer and I feel like I leave one home and then walk into my other home.  I absolutely love lovE loVE lOVE LOVE Echo Coffee.  I have never had a bad experience here and the baristas are my favorite.  The owner, Steve, is my favorite.  And the fabulous customers that come in are my favorite.  I have met so many great people at Echo Coffee.  And oh their menu is grand!  The great thing is everyone that works here is highly knowledgable about their products. It is a great place to meet for business or with family and friends.  I cannot find one negative comment anywhere in me!

Atmosphere, service, amazing coffee... it's all there at Echo. 
I went around 2:30 and it wasn't too crowded, the noise level was low but enough that it was a good stimulating environment. The barista was super nice and friendly and great energy. I ordered a iced caramel latte and there was barely a wait. 

This was probably the best latte I ever had. And I'm usually not a latte person. But this latte was wonderful.

The atmosphere is great- there are fun places to sit ( everything from tables to couches and a patio). It has a very open feel to it, and there is cool art and books and what not. 

I cannot wait to go back again and try some more. I think I'll be a regular there from now on.

This place is probably my favorite coffee in AZ. The people working are very friendly and helpful. They have a nice food selection, not the best but nothing more than I expect. I would probably come more if they had breakfast sandwiches. Anyway, the place is great, the coffee fires you up as good coffee should and the people watching us above average being situated at the corner of Thomas and 68th. Enjoy!

I'm a big fan of this place, namely their cinnamon-heavy chai lattes (which often come with cute latte art!).

Pros:
- Each drink comes with a tiny biscuit/rusk-like bite (yum...wish I could buy a few extra when I get my lattes)
- Wifi is good
- LATTE ART (sometimes)
- If dining/drinking in, they use real glass and drinkware. Beats recyclable stuff any day
- Moderately friendly staff

Cons (being nit-picky now)
- Very limited seating outdoors, even though IMO there is room for a few more tables
- Small parking lot, though I've never had an issue with finding a spot with waiting at max 1-2 minutes for someone to leave

This is by far my favorite coffee spot! Organic coffee with a wide variety of options to choose from. They also serve a few lunch items and baked goods, which are all great! The atmosphere is very relaxed even though the place is often packed. I'm not a coffee drinker per say, but I enjoy iced coffee. Everyone is super friendly working here. Service is quick and on point. There are times when they will now see me pulling up and have my order waiting for me. The brew of ice coffee is super strong and tastes so good I drink it plain and without additional flavoring or with a little Stevia and it's great! U cannot compare the quality of coffee to anywhere else especially their iced coffee brew. I highly recommend this place to anyone who enjoys coffee.
Best latte ever. Very smooth! This place is right next to my hair salon. Love places that carry all the milk alternatives. Cute and good vibes. Very nice staff.

This week my quest for the perfect coffee shop experience took me to Echo. I like the trendy name, every time I told someone I was going there I felt very exclusive. I'm a dork. :)

  I like the big patio with with lots of big chairs. I walked in and was instantly in love. They have big metal shelves right when you walk in that have books on them. Not like lame books no one would ever want to read but actual, recent, best sellers books. The counter was nice n clean with melittas sitting there ready to brew. If you knew me you'd know that I am a sucker for alternate brewing methods and Melittas are some of my very favorite. 

The woman ordering when I walked in was geeking out over the coffee girl's awesome hair and I stood back, relaxed and listened. I'm always open to tips on hair color. The hipster poster child barista asked me if he could get something started for me with a nice, warm, welcoming smile. I ordered a cappuccino, warm, in a for here mug. In fact, the rave reviews of their cappuccinos are what brought me here in the first place. 

When I walked up to pay the girl asked if I'd worked in coffee. Busted. She said she could tell by the way I ordered my cup. I'll take it. 

Enough of the awesome people behind the counter. Let's talk about the cup. Beautiful latte art aside, the cappuccino was a little wetter than I like them to be. It didn't quite have the texture of melted ice cream like it should. Okay, I'm being picky. The cappuccino was great, the people were great. I'm not saying this is the end of my search but I will be visiting again.

This coffee shop is so close to my place that I enjoy walking to it. They have great coffee and love how they make their drip coffee. They grind it for you and use the single use filters and individually make them per order. Their Chi is really good too! They are sustainable and use Eco friendly cups and if the order if for sit down they put their drink in glass tumblers. I love going to this place!

I used to live near this coffee shop and would frequent it often! The coffee is always smooth and  when I order the almond milk lattes they are made to perfection! They have an amazing drip coffee & fantastic pastries. My favorite is the chocolate chip scone right when it's fresh out of the oven, since the chocolate is so warm. You won't be disappointed with their coffee. They also have some comfy couches in the back, so you can read or do some work on your laptop.

I'm a huge fan of both the drip coffee and the espresso at Echo.  The espresso drinks are truly a work of art and the little shortbread cookie they come with make it extra special.  They also have some great baked goods (morning glory, zucchini & blueberry, banana breads) and some fresh salads on the menu.  Oh, and their 'Best Darned Grilled Cheese' on sourdough is very, very yummy.

While I've been coming here periodically since they first opened over 3 years ago, the real reason I'm writing this review is because over the past three months or so, I've been spending a significant amount of time at Echo.  Because I was preparing for an upcoming professional exam, I was studying every evening from 7pm to 10pm after work and Echo was my go-to source of caffeine and free WiFi.  Over those three months, I can honestly say the staff was genuinely friendly every single visit and the coffee never failed me.  I feel very lucky to have a great local coffee shop like Echo near me and urge everyone to give it a try.  You won't regret it.

Echo coffee will forever hold my number one spot in the PHX area to get a coffee, and hang out... for an entire day. I'm not sure how I would have made it through ASU without it! The setting is small and quiet for the most part. The staff and patrons are great people - always willing to strike up a conversation during study breaks.

The coffee, drip or lattes, are amazing... and they also have the best dirty chai I've ever had! When you take your coffee in house, you get actual glassware, which is always a huge plus in my book! Then, when you are there for the long hall, they carry small bites and pastries. Just enough to get you through a few more assignments!
Fantastic art, great coffee, nice chill atmosphere. The pastries and coffee are amazing ! Such a great authentic coiffed spot in this area. Great for socializing and studying

My review is from January 2011, when I was working in Scottsdale (cannot believe I forgot to review). 

I had several great espressos and coffees at Echo Coffee.  The people  were very friendly and accommodating. Had a great time chatting with owner Steve about quality coffee and running a cafe.  Echo is a great space that feels very comfortable.  I will definitely return.

Stopped in try Echo today on my way to work. The coffee was VERY good. I really enjoyed my iced latte. Had a great flavor and was very smooth. I do agree that it was a little pricey, but not so much more than other places. 

Atmosphere was okay. There are other coffee joints I'd rather "hang" in. The staff wasn't rude but wasn't friendly either.

I wasn't really blown away by Echo Coffee, but I could go back again.

Love Echo coffee, I head over here every morning at 6-7am. They open early and have great nooks for reading and hanging out. Good lighting, wonderful art work and the coffee's bar none. Really strong drip coffee or cold brew available , it's a "Titus Blend". Just made an awesome french press with the Titus Blend and am jamming out on la computadora at 4:10am Monday getting a ton of stuff done!
Thanks Echo you rock.

I.almost forgot about this little place until i just passed it the other day...this place is.fsbulous!! My dad would bring our office treats from here almost every week for months and they were addicting...the apricot and raspberry bars are to die for...they are chewy and buttery but not too sweet at all...the chocolate chip cookie is amazing!! i think its the zucchini bread but that is amazing its moist and the frosting is a perfect addition...i love this little place my sis and i used to go here last summer to.get their chai soy iced lattes and they were so good...its completely different then any other chai latte i have ever had...i do not think they add sugar to their chai which is a nice change...dont get me wrong i love my other chai lattes from other places too but this one just seems a little more refreshing and light.  I need to go.to this place.more.often.its not that far from my house or job either...i would recommend this place to everyone and i hope this place stays around for a long time...they offer wifi and its a lil hip place to go and get away for a bit or to get some work done! Try it!!!!!!

I'm not much of a coffee dranker but I do like their coffee out of all the places around the South Scottsdale area including cartel. The baked goods are also delicious. I really like the blue berry muffins.

First visit and I had a drip coffee and the tuna sandwich. Both were excellent. Sandwich though was borderline pricey @ $8.  Service was efficient and prompt. Ambiance was nothing special and had a very much starbucks feel. 

Overall impressions: not bad, not great

This coffee shop rocks!!  I enjoy the rotating art, music, and staff just as much as the coffee itself. I have ordered the vanilla latte which comes out at the perfect drinking temperature and I'm a sucker for the foam art :) try their sweets too. They also can customize your teas from hot to iced.

Lived not too far from Echo Coffee. This place is really pretty and comfortable, several tables as well as a few chairs, love seats and sofas. What more could you ask for. Used to come here a on occasion. If I were passing by or if it was to late and I didn't feel like going to far from home. They have a good assortment of bakery items here, as well as sandwhiches and other food items. Big glass windows that look out onto the street and the other side looks onto the parking lot.  Echo is not so much about loud noise it's more of a place for quite contemplation or study. Not as hustle and bustle as some of the other cafes in the area. But that's just fine it's a really nice cafe. If you find your self in South Scottsdale or any where on East Thomas road. Skip Starbucks and pop into Echo Coffee, I think you'll be pleasantly surprised and enjoy some good coffee or tea.

Excellent coffee drinks.  I got my mocha to go and they even took the time to make the cool foam design on it even though it was soon covered by the to-go top.  Very friendly staff and I was in and out in a flash.  What more could you want?

Try:
- Mocha
I love echo coffee.  This is a great study spot with delicious lattes.

I wanted to like Echo. I tried for the last year that I've worked nearby, being that it's so close and not a chain. I don't like Starbucks because I drink my coffee black. I just can't find anything to like about Echo other than ONE of the staff members, the rest I have to greet myself when I walk in. I am first to say, "hello, how are you" and being in customer service my whole life... I don't think that's a lot for me to expect. But nope. Not even a smile. Nothing genuine. Ever. On top of that, the coffee inspires a sour face from me, regardless of how I switch it up. I tried getting one pump of chai for flavor as I usually get at other shops. (Yes their chai is a flavor pump, not real chai) and it was all at the bottom of my iced coffee. Never mixed.  Thanks guys. Glad I tip every time just to be treated like garbage and hate my coffee. I tried for a year and have decided it's worth it to go out of my way to another shop.  I give 2 stars simply for the quiet atmosphere. Although the couches are tearing and the bathroom is broken. :/

So it's taken a few years for really good coffee places to get a foothold in Phoenix.  This is one of the best.  Great coffee - excellent cappuccinos and baristas that know the art of good coffee.  Also very good quality naked good.  Blueberry muffins are delish!
Just got the cold brewed coffee, and carrot bread. Both are fantastic. Super friendly staff, and chill environment that is nice and quiet. Very nice coffee shop, first visit and not the last!

I enjoyed a raspberry danish and Latte while waiting for new tires to be installed at the nearby Advanced Auto Service and Tire center.

I didn't really know what to expect since this was my first visit.  I found the place to be a great place to hang out with a coffee while reading or surfing the web.  I found the latte to be very good and enjoyed every sip of it.  I will definitely be back to try some other coffee drinks and possibly try one of their food items.

Echo Coffee is hands down the finest coffee shop in the valley! Its absolutely my favorite for a number of reasons. Megan and Ayla are phenomenal baristas! Their award winning drip coffee is something special and their mochas and Americanos are to die for. The atmosphere is perfect for students & professionals as they have fast internet, great music (especially when Ayla is there) and great coffee. I can honestly say that Echo Coffee was apart of my recent completion of my MBA. Thanks Echo and thanks Ayla & Megan for being apart of my life.

I love this place. I love the coffee. I love the fact that the owner and most of the baristas seem to have more than a touch of perfectionism running through their veins.

I'm just a skinny latte girl, and they not only don't mess it up here, they make it right.  I like the tiny shortbread cookie they give you (even though mine usually disappears), I like the fact that they brought in different types of milks, and I like that you get organic milk without paying extra.

I also like the fact that when sisters and I have kids in tow, we never seem to get any flak for it. From patrons or employees.

The only thing I would say is if the baristas make a mistake, don't get pissy with each other for bad communication.  Fix it.  They all seem like they could relax just a tad.

Better lattes than Lux or Cartel !!!! They have great loafs too -- especially like the blueberry one. Pecan pie was good as well. Ambiance was lacking but would choose their latte over the other cafes above.

Pretty decent coffee. Pleasant atmosphere, friendly baristas and a cool vibe make it a nice place to chill. The coffee wasn't exceptional per se, but it was pretty good, and Phoenix is rather lacking in good coffee. Would recommend if you frequent the area.

Echo Coffee house rocks.  This recently opened coffee house/restaurant is a real treat.  It has a friendly staff, lots of seating, good salads and sandwiches.  There is free WiFi, which is great.  They don't care how long you stay.  It's not in a strip mall, but a freestanding, beautifully designed building on the northwest corner of 68th Street and Thomas. In our part of town, there haven't been many choices, but with the opening of LoLo's and now Echo Coffee, we're on a roll.

So friendly! The employees here are great & always give excellent service. I found out Echo Coffee was opening in my neighborhood on twitter & facebook, so I followed the pre-opening progress & was excited to see it open.

The owner Steve is super nice, & always willing to listen to customer feedback. It has become a great place for me to get work done at and occasionally hang out with friends. Steve roasts the beans in the shop & is very serious about putting out a great product. I've noticed the staff gets better at making the drinks every time I go in there.

I'd love it if there were some surge strips to plug more computers into, but hopefully that will happen soon. Nice to have coffee that's 100% higher quality than the Starbucks we've been stuck with in the neighborhood.
I always get the stag beans, today I decided to also get the titus beans!  I am very very happy.  Titus is AMAZING.  thank you

Echo Coffeehouse is off of 68th Street and Thomas in a brand new building shell.  They did a great job with the TI's and are right across the street from TT's Roadhouse. 

My wife and I stop there because it is a convenient place to meet, always has parking and they do a great job with the coffee (I get Iced Coffee; she gets Tea or water) and an even better job on the sandwiches.  I recommend either the Tuna Sandwich (made of white beans/tuna/light olive oil on flat bread) or the Curry Chicken.  Both times we ate there the food was fresh, well made and well presented.  I recommend this place to anyone who likes well-made, light lunches with a good, cold coffee drink.  

What would give it FIVE stars would be for it to survive the summer and host live music and/or art stuff at night.

My wife and I finally stopped by Echo Coffee together last Saturday night after having dinner elsewhere.  It was slow and quiet, but that was just fine by us.  We went there to have a good cup of coffee and talk, and that's exactly what we got.

We arrived at around 8:30pm to find only one employee working the counter.  She was busy making another customer's coffee, and I'm pretty sure she expected us to place our order to her back.  I waited until she was ready for us, though, and she almost seemed annoyed that I did.  She was pleasant enough but not very friendly or conversational.  She just took our order and moved on.  I thought part of the charm of local businesses was that they care about your patronage and show it....  Nevertheless, the iced latte I had and the Americano my wife had were both very good.

I'd definitely visit Echo Coffee again, but I wouldn't go out of my way for it, either.

First time at Echo today - stopped in and grabbed a Latte.  REALLY good espresso.  Nice staff.  A pretty serious crowd - almost full - and everyone either working or studying.  Super glad that everyone is hanging there, but it was a bit library like with everyone working away and virtually no conversations going on.  Anyway - great caffeine - I'll be back.

Okay I have found my new favorite "home office!"  I don't have an office for my agency yet so coffee shops tend to be where I get most of my work done.

Last week I checked out Echo Coffee for a client meeting and we both really liked it.  Today I returned and spent a few hours working at Echo Coffee on their wi-fi. It was such a nice break from my usual home office at Starbucks.  Walking into Echo Coffee you can instantly tell its a different type of coffee experience.  The environment is very relaxing, music is not blasting so customers don't have to scream over each other, and they have great big couches in the back.  Of course atmosphere and great coffee needs to be in balance and it definitely was at Echo.

The coffee is really good and love very fair price for the quality you get (my 2 favs are Cappuccino at $2.75 and $3.75 for large Chai Latte).  My chai latte came in a big ceramic mug.  I don't know about you but there is just something special enjoying coffee out of big mugs and not recyclable paper cups.

A surprising first for me is getting actual lunch at a coffee place and was pleasantly surprised to find the food was also really good.  Can you tell I am a fan yet?  I ordered a Curry Chicken sandwich and it was huge and delicious so finished the whole thing.  There was a nice bonus on the plate - Mango Chutney so make sure you get that if you order lunch at Echo.  I would have loved just a bowl of that and bread as its flavor was so good.  I need to find out where they get this from as I want to have it at home. About $12.50 for my huge Chai tea and curry chicken sandwich.

I have been to Echo several times in the past few weeks. The coffee is wonderful. I had one experience of the coffee simply not getting ready and finally checking and somebody had forgotten to make it, but in general it's been fine.
My biggest complaint is that the bathroom is really filthy. I mentioned it today when I was in there and got a pretty surly look from the young woman at the register, which was discouraging. Business owners should want their places to be clean. Of course, she is probably not the owner, but she needs to learn a little about customer service and at least pretend that she likes to make the customers happy. I'll be back next week, and hope that someone has gone after the dirty bathroom!
A nice spot, modern decor, friendly staff, tasty house-made goodies, and a great latte...oh yes a parking lot too. Thankfully not a Starbucks clone.

Disclaimer: I've known Steve (the owner) for a few years and he's a great guy. 
Disclaimer: I'm also a coffee dork and even though I know Steve and he's a great guy I wouldn't pull punches if the place wasn't up to par!
Disclaimer: I think I'm addicted to disclaimers now...

This place has great coffee, a great space, and a great attitude. Steve roasts his own coffee and is very passionate about the quality of the beans he's producing. If you catch him there, ask him about it at your own risk. You will get a LOT of great info.

There is a lot of thought in their menu, though it may not be apparent at first. For example, there are no blended drinks (like Frappucinos) not because Steve is a coffee snob, but because the blenders make a lot of noise and he wants people to be able to relax and work without being disturbed. Their space is very flexible with several couches, tables, and chairs for a casual conversation or to get some work done.

The coffee menu is also fairly simple, encouraging discussion between employees and customers if there is something specific they want. The staff is very accommodating, and willing to help or explain.  They have a nice set of food menu items to accompany the drinking portion of things.  It's a very well rounded, very great addition to the local coffee scene!

Disclaimer: This is the last disclaimer.

Walked in around 730 pm on a Wednesday night.  Almost thought I stepped into a library.  Every person in the place had laptops open and was studying.  Kind of wierd.  Anyways, library or not, this place can make an espresso! Very good and served in a ceramic cup. Will definitely be back.  Maybe I will bring something to study

I visited Echo Coffee even though it's far from my neighborhood because my friend Carylann is the chef.  So that's my full disclosure.

I ordinarily don't enjoy Scottsdale-I never feel dressed "right" and I hate navigated the parking downtown.  I don't venture into the city often, but I would definitely hang out here.  The shop is easy to find; it's on the corner of Thomas and 68th on the northwest corner.  The parking lot is plenty big.  When you enter the shop it's modern without feeling pretentious or too hipster-y. Ample seating and gorgeous lighting by way of large windows and light fixtures.

The coffee menu is straightforward and I like the way they prepare coffee.  It's unusual and feels true to the product.  They pour hot water into a coffee filter for each cup, and it pours through into the mug.  My friend Susan ordered a cappuccino which was appropriately sized.  Each beverage was served with a tiny shortbread cookie-nice touch and something I've never seen done in Phoenix in any coffee shop.

The food menu was small but had a nice variety of pastries, sandwiches, and quiches.  I tried a bacon/spinach quiche and it was delicious!  Carylann also brought us out a piece of coffee cake.  Drool. I am still thinking about driving back for seconds.  The top was crumbly and generous.  She told us a story about when she was a little girl, she'd always order coffee cake and wish it had the topping inside the cake as well.  So she included a topping layer on the inside of hers! Yum!

Cool coffee shop that is much needed in the heart of the "starbucks controlled area" in old town. Each drink is made carefully with time put into it. Not a great place if you are in a rush for this reason. Nice decor throughout.

Excellent coffee experience.  It's so pleasing to find a go-to coffee joint in a new city.  I only visit Phoenix for work once in a while, but Echo will now be my place! 

They roast their own beans in-house, they grind only seconds before the brew, and they slow brew right in front of you.  They have a pastry chef as well!!  It was hard for me to resist the beautiful pastries and opt for a banana - alas, due to my random burst of willpower I cannot attest to the pastries.  I'll have some food next time around, and at that point I expect I'll boost my score from a 4 to a 5. 

They do have Wi-Fi - you get a code on your receipt which allows you access. 

It's an experience.  Go!
This place has great atmosphere, great coffee, and top notch friendly baristas. Great place to be productive!

Coffee that is dripping right in front of your eyes was the highlight of this visit. The individually dripping coffee didn't taste much different than coffee from a pot, so despite the show I'm not sure what is the big draw with that item. Also snagged a fresh choc. chip scone and that had a few good bites. Barista was in a pretty grumpy mood, but everyone has a bad day or three. Good local coffee shop if you live in the area.

I ordered a large coffee in, not to go. Just more hot water is added to the large not more beans as I watched both sizes being made. Also sat there getting cold as they prepared coffees to go for others. This is the second day in a row it was bad coffee. Done with this echo coffee. Let me remind you that 50% of your states budget is dependent on tourism dollars.
Seems like to many people want to get rich quick with bad service and less quality.

I just got back from this place just now, Nov 21 at 3 PM.  I created a Yelp account just to review them I am so annoyed.  I initially went in this morning and got a coffee and a pear muffin.  I drank my coffee on the way to work, it was excellent.  I started to eat my muffin and noticed there was no pear taste.  Thinking maybe it was a muffin with pear compote in the middle, I sliced it in half.  No pear.  So basically it was a sugar muffin---obviously I opted to refrain from eating this.  No big deal, I'm not an irrational person, I realize things happen and people make mistakes.  But at $3 a pop, it wasn't cheap.  This place is very close to my house, so I decided to stop back on my way home and exchange the muffin for another one, NBD right?   I went to the front and explained that the pear muffin had no pear, and could I please exchange it for another one.  I received a skeptical "ok" and a dirty look from the barista.  No sorry or even a remote hint of understanding of any kind.  She then proceeded to give the other barista an incredulous look right in front of me.  I took my muffin, said thanks, and left.  To the owner of this establishment: you have great coffee (Seattle native), but you may want to coach the barista working 11/21 in the afternoon some basic customer service skills.  This is honestly one of the worst customer service interactions I've ever encountered, and I lived in Boston at one point.  I will not be back.

Echo is a decent neighborhood spot with a few issues.  The positive things here are the pastries- which are always great. The coffee is good too, for the most point. Service is always friendly. 

The negatives include slow service (possibly understaffed?) and a weird seating area. I wish they could have a consultant come in and help them set up the place more efficiently. It's a large sized space that can seat 7 people for some reason. Also on the far side of the place are some sofas and love seats that look like someone has been murdered whilst sitting in them. They are seriously beat up and stained. I know it's no fun buying new furniture - but damn these are really in rough shape. 

So to recap- decent place but there are opportunities to improve.

Checked this place out finally. I am a fan. Guy roasting his own stuff is great. drip to order  is good. Chatty friendly non stuck up staff is excellent. 

I will be back for sure.

I've been meaning to write a FIVE STAR review. Coming here for about a year. Customer service has NEVER been their strong suit, but the products themselves are always top quality, so I keep coming. 
Starting with yesterday, I came in and ordered a shot in my latte and did not receive one. No big deal. I also ordered one of their delicious slices of bread and it turned out they gave me the wrong one... Unfortunately, I discovered all of this after I got back into my car, on my way to work...
Well today I went in with the same orderand kindly let them know that there was no shot in my latte yesterday and the cashier kindly comp'd me for it (best customer service yet), while the barista (same from yesterday) gave me "the stink eye"! Surprised by his reaction, I forgot to say almond milk. So when the cashier told him, after he had already started making it with regular milk, he threw his head back and rolled his eyes!!!!! I could not believe it!!
Unfortunately, this is what has finally prompted me to write my review. 
I hope the hiring manager is able to read this and considers hiring a better staff. And then train them on proper customer service.

Awesome local spot without the hipster pretentious attitude. The beans are amazing - I usually keep their in house Titus beans stocked at my house. The baked goods are to die for and worth all the calories. They are usually piping hot and fresh, too. I usually go for the Americano with some added agave syrup and a hot scone. 

Only downside is one or two of the baristas can be a bit slow-mo but it's worth the wait.

We used to come to Echo because we thought the coffee was so good, smoothe and tasty. Today, we decided that none of the adjectives applied to the coffee we had today. The staff lacks any enthusiasm and pride and the place is so chopped up wth this station and another place for this  and yet another station with a frigerator ....Furniture is old and used to the point it should be replaced by IKEA . It's in need of help with products, staff and the interior. I doubt whether we will go back unless I see some raves about the basics of nice staff. Sorry, but you can't treat people with total
Lack of enthusiasm and expect us to return! I get better service at the  national chain!
I love this place! It's in my neighborhood, so I often stop in for a coffee or a chai tea. Echo serves the best chai tea, by far my favorite that I've found in scottsdale.

Open architecture which is nice. Pretty quiet setting. Quite a few people hanging out for the long term study session. 

I had coffee there with a friend and got a decaf pour over drip coffee and a gluten free chocolate chip peanut butter bar. 

The coffee was too acidic for me. I drank about 3/4 of the cup but by the time I got to that point, I was not enjoying the flavor.  The bar was very good.
Great cappuccinos and drinks and the best study environment. The staff are also very friendly. If you have alot of work and need a good place to focus then I deffentily recommend echo.

Wow, I cannot believe I have somehow missed a review of Echo Coffee when I have been telling everyone that I know about it!

I love that it is local.  I love that it is NOT bohemian (though I like those types of coffee shops too), meaning, it has a certain atmosphere of modernity and professionalism.  It is less frenzied than many other coffee shops I have frequented.  I love the food, and I think it is significant to note that they offer more than donuts and sweet rolls; the salads and sandwiches are great!  And ya gotta love it when they say, "Please sit down, and we'll bring it to you when it's ready."  Yea!
Coffee is always fresh. Sandwiches are great. Service is fast and the employees seem to be cheery and helpful.  I like this cafe. Try the turkey and brie.

This is a great location to grab a caffeine boost during the day or on the way to work. It's conveniently located if you're in the Old Town area and the service is quick. The coffee is pretty good too. Mine didn't have an overwhelming taste; it was pretty smooth and subtle. I ordered a flat white (my favorite - no, it's not an espresso or a no-foam latte) and they whipped it up without much hesitation. The only drawback of this establishment is that the seating is kind of awkward, crowded and uncomfortable. It is nice that they have some plush seating if you can snag some property lol

Their coffee is to die for. It's fresh, smooth and their simple menu is lovely. Their handmade pastries are on point!! All of the breads- morning glory, blueberry cinnamon- and scones are so amazingly good. Their prices are fair and there is never a long wait. It's easy to find and open at the perfect times when you need and want coffee. I always get the iced mocha latte with almond milk and it's beautiful. Highly recommend.
Awesome lattes, a wide array of seating, chill music, and free wifi what more can you ask for of a coffee shop.

Echo Coffee is rockin'!  I am in love with their coffee and espresso drinks.  

I have gone in several times a week since they opened and I see that Echo is getting more popular.  I usually run in for a to-go cup, but last weekend I met a girlfriend there and we visited for 2 hours.  They offer sofas and table with chairs, so it's quite comfortable to sit and talk or get some work done (with their FREE Wi-Fi).

The staff is always friendly and helpful.  I haven't tried any pastries yet - not because I haven't wanted to because they look delicious.  I had a small cookie on my latte saucer last weekend and it was delicious. 

Echo Coffee is proving to be a great little independent coffee shop.  Their beans are roasted on site and I can tell it's a labor of love for the owner.

Awesome place to get a really yummy cup of coffee and do some work (free wifi & lots of tables). The interior reminds me of Starbucks, which is a compliment in my book. There are outdoor tables, indoor tables, bar stools, and sofa seating. The people working there are really nice and will bring your coffee to your table if you're staying. The thing I love most is the standard cup of joe is an amazing cup of freshly ground pour-over coffee and it is absolutely perfect. Smoky, thick, hot, and delicious. It's miles ahead of normal drip coffee. Thinking about it makes me want to drive over there for some.
Pretty good coffee, decent atmosphere. Their furniture, however, was in need of a deep clean last time I was there... The couch in the back was incredibly dingy and dirty.

Love this place. Personally I like modern, contemporary styles of coffee shops. If you are looking for that atmosphere, you should try this amazing coffee place. People are super-friendly here, the latte tastes awesome.
Last sunday, I tried the drip coffee, the taste of heaven. 
The most important thing! good place to read and study. 

I have been trying so much to find the coffee shop like here, this place was the best ever for myself in scottsdale/tempe/phoenix area.

I will definitively return,, maybe on coming weekend?! :D
Great atmosphere. I love coming here to study or read, they always have good music. The coffee is local and organic, and their latte art is so great! Food is delicious as well.

(Full disclosure: Proprietor Steve Belt is a friend of mine, but trust me, if he'd goofed this up, I'd say so...)

Here I sit, sucking up the free wifi at Scottsdale's newest independently owned coffee shop, Echo Coffee.

Over by the comfy couches and chairs, there's a coffee roaster cooking away as I type (TV is on the way). Steve is serious about his coffee and is watching over that thing like a mother hen. 

Some delightful looking fresh-baked cookies and pastries and a basket of fresh fruit are available if you're hungry. (Steve & company are fleshing out the menu).

The atmosphere is great, and there's been a steady stream of customers coming in.

Oh, and the coffee is spectacular. 

My only beef is it's not in Gilbert and closer to home. I could hang out in a place like this all day....

The staff is super friendly and helped me choose a drink. I ended up ordering a latte. It was OK. Music is loud inside, outdoor seating is not ideal as it is located right on 68th st. Food looked tasty, I'll probably order a baked good if I come again.

1. Solid cappuccino. The other coffee drinks are probably just as good, but I haven't tried them so can't comment.
2. Great pastries. I've tried the vegan chocolate sandwich cookie (dark chocolate flavor), banana bread (yum), lemon loaf (more yum), chocolate chip cookie....all have been quickly and happily consumed.
3. Free wifi! And it works!
4. Nice baristas.
5. Decent number of outlets for charging your i-Things. 
6. Trendy atmosphere in unassuming strip mall in south Scottsdale.
7. Local shop!
8. They roast their own beans.

Come check this place out!

Espresso: Decent
Food: Oatmeal was good.  It was obviously microwaved - a little too much for my taste..
Vibe: Drive here and hang out. New.
WiFi: Yes - fast and free
Plugs: ?.
Soy Out?: No.
Score: Good study vibe
Very nice and off the beaten path. Lots to read. Excellent coffee and the sweets are soooo good.
Love this place for pre-work coffee meetings! Echo has good coffee without hipster- or Scottsdale-brand pretensions. Also, decent parking if other businesses nearby aren't open yet.

We were visiting the area and needed a good coffee. Thanks to Yelp members, Echo had great reviews. Their decaf espresso did NOT disappoint! Rather, it weilds a smooth buttery sweetness with a very satisfying aftertaste. They use single-origin Brazilian beans. It's safe to say that you will not find a better coffee without much effort.

We preferred to take our coffee out as the ambience didn't match our moods.

Echo is right around the corner from my house. I'm not a big coffee drinker so I stop in only a few times a month. 

The atmosphere is hipster chic like pretty much every other coffee place in the area. The staff is friendly and the service is usually pretty quick. I like supporting a local biz so I always prefer coming here over Starbucks. They make a bomb Chai Latte and I love they have almond milk as a diary substitute.

My only complaint is they only offer two sizes and the large isn't very big. Maybe it's the fat American in me but sometimes I want a monster sized coffee and can't get that here. 

Great coffee but gimme more!

I came here with my wife to meet up with a friend.

I walk in and think this place is pretty neat. It's  got a good feel to it and the barista was very nice. 

I had an Americano -- one of the best I've had in awhile. 

It's out of the way for me, but if I'm ever in the area I would totally go back!

Too loud again!  Is like a disco in here.  Is this a nightclub?  Was having a relaxing time here until the music got loud.  I used to go here twice a week.  But haven't been back in months.  Just got too annoyed with not being able to hear myself think in there.  Great coffee.  Decent baked goods.  Once I saw the staff made themselves great looking sandwiches that they ate in front of me, so I asked to order one and was told I couldn't.
One of my new favorite spots.  Plenty of tables chairs and couches to work or relax at.  Good coffee (not the worlds best but still very good).   Their espresso drinks are pretty good too.
The location is convenient for me, but not only are their lattes delicious, the atmosphere is great, and the people are so friendly without being obnoxious.

A strong 4.5. (Yelp? Where are the halfsies?) 

I love this place. Great coffee, good food, great service all wrapped up in wifi and a super cool, large space - with parking!!!

There for a working lunch with my business partner, it was the ideal spot. We both had sandwiches. Partner had tuna, I had chicken pesto. I'd give mine a solid B (I'm pretty opinionated about my pesto...) - bread was fresh, chicken moist, red peppers were raw on a hot sandwich which would have been okay if they were thinly sliced. Pesto was plentiful but not quite spot on for me. I can't speak to the tuna - partner enjoyed it in its entirety. Brewed coffee was delish. Service, awesome. We both said we would come back. And bonus points to echo's owner who thanked us as we left. Ahhh the humanity.
They have the best iced tea and banana walnut bred. Definitely a cute and delicious place to try!

After hearing about this place which is close to my house I had to go check it out. Great atmosphere. Owner is very involved and seems as willing to talk to you as you are to him. Staff is upbeat and that's always a plus in my book. I'm not the biggest coffee drinker but I had a latte and it was excellent and last but not least if you can't stand Starbucks because it's too much of a coffee Walmart, this has everything you need (good lighting, free wifi,etc). 

Bonus: I got to bump into Yelp's own Gabi, Queen of the Phoenix coffee shops.

First time here and the service was speedy. The iced toddy in my humble opinion was of everage quality. It was very drinkable but nothing to throw a party over. The baked goods are very tasty however they don't seem to prewar their pastries which I've also had happen at other places (maybe it's a new thing) parking is limited. Multiple 30 minute only parking spots. The regular spots with no time limit seem to get taken up quickly by the other businesses and their patrons. If your coming here to work you may have to move your vehicle although I was not asked to. The staff is very friendly and they have very plush sofas that are super comfy (I suffer from spinal neuropathy) so the plush couches are a plus. I'm definitely going to be giving echo a couple more shots. Their price point was very nice. 3.50 for a large toddy. I'm used to 4.50.. they are equipped with out door seating and the WiFi is pretty rockin as well. They are also bicycle friendly. There's also a bike shop next door to them.

Fantastic coffee, good customer service,  and very laid back environment! This is a great place for those looking to relax or study over a great cup of coffee. My boyfriend and I went for the first time yesterday evening around 9:00pm. It wasn't very busy, but there was still a good amount of people considering it was 9:00. I ordered a Chai Tea latte and was very pleased with the quality! 
I definitely recommend checking it out!

Almond milk latte is my new favorite thing in the world. And this coffee shop is my new go-to for a spot to study. Good internet strength, comfortable inside and out for lounging, working or eating lunch, and for the most part friendly and nice people behind the counter. Mostly mellow indie music playing, but not so loud that you couldn't tune it out with headphones. My dogs love to hang out on the patio while I work, and the staff are great, when they're not super busy they bring the dogs water and my drink out to me. 

This place gives Cartel a run for their money with good drip as well as espresso drinks. Good roasted blends available to bring home, though Cartel might have better beans for home brewing. 

Also, if you're going to be posted up for a long time, Pizza Re is basically right next door, and you can grab a slice real quick and come back and get back to work. 

Did I mention great ambiance?

Stopped by for a coffee break.  The drip coffee is uber fresh and delicious, the beans were smooth and not too acidic, we didn't need to add sugar or milk as the coffee was quite tasty nor too strong.  The atmosphere is laid back and if you need to get some work done and have a cup of joe then this should be a good spot for you.

The coffee ain't bad but the owner really rubbed me the wrong way. I ordered an iced Americano and wanted a bit of vanilla syrup in it. The owner then gave me a look and went on about taking away from the true coffee taste. It looks like I am not the only one who has experienced this either. I'll be back simply because the coffee was pretty good and I like supporting local but will avoid the owner for fear of getting an inferiority complex.
As a cafe and coffee lover, out of the many cafes I've tried in AZ this one is one of my favorites. The espresso is just right and every time I order its always satisfying.

I came here to try to get some work done one day because the hotel room was just starting to give me cabin fever. I am glad I found this place because they're open late, serve food, are friendly, have great wifi and plugs EVERYWHERE ... and make excellent coffee.

I admit the latte art wasn't blowing me away, but I like that they serve a little snack with your coffee like a lot of European coffee shops do. Their lattes are pretty smooth and for the most part good except the foam to coffee ratio was a little ridiculous. 

The cafe is dark, so if you come in the evening hours, just make sure your eyes can adjust to your bright screen and the dim-ness around you. They have indoor lighting but for some reason its super weak.

I like that the parking is easy, it is located near an intersection, on a major street, and there is plenty of indoor and outdoor seating available. Recommended for coffee snobs!

Second time around, this place was much better. The latte I ordered was very smooth and tasty. I had a chocolate peanut butter bar and that was still just okay. Maybe I caught them on an off day the last time. Not great, but definitely good and I'd come back.

I don't normally give stars lower than 5, but this coffee shop doesn't deserve my 5. 

I've been driving past this coffee shop and have always been curious to see what they have in here. So yesterday, I finally got the chance to see what's up. 

They're open until 10pm everyday which I think is pretty cool because most of the coffee places around the Scottsdale area close up pretty early (I'm used to seeing coffee shops like Starbucks open for 24hours which is not a common thing here). So I come in, and Look at the interiors, I loved the paintings on the wall and how they decorated the place. The food server was nice, their coffee was good and their chocolate PECAN pie was bomb! HOWEVER, with the area in general, they have what looks like some kind of machine across the room which made the place look a little messy with some random ace hard ware bucket on top of the machine. AND, at the time of my visit, there was only one person working who was pretty much doing everything around from taking orders, making coffee, to cleaning up and bussing tables and serving. And I feel so bad because there were a decent amount of people last night and one of him. My 5 stars goes to the server and the food but the overall place doesn't deserve my 5 stars.

The coffee shop has the opportunity to be a much better coffee shop and I hope the owner sees it and do something about it.

I am in love with Echo Coffee. It's tucked away in an unassuming strip mall in Scottsdale that you likely wouldn't notice if you weren't looking for it, which adds to Echo's charm. The small coffee shop serves up delicious drinks and a great menu of lunchtime classics and snacks that are sure to please. 

I showed up for the first time on a day when the power had been out in the store for most of the morning. It had just come back on and the staff were friendly as can be. I must say, my favorite part was the soundtrack playing in the background, which featured some of the best mellow, coffee shop music I've experienced in town. It's a great place to meet a friend, study, or settle in on the comfy sofas with a good book and some comfort food. I'd definitely recommend this place!
Came here last week. It has a great atmosphere. The iced chai tea latte was delicious and my boyfriend really likes the espresso and drip

Stopped in for the first time and the atmosphere was nice. The girl up front was friendly and this feels like a place you want to be. I asked the girls what she likes because I didn't know what to get and I basically ended up with a carmel latte. It was good but I've had better. I'd come here over Starbucks for sure and they have a gluten free BLT on the menu I'm dying to try. Really deserves 3.5 stars.

I love this place. Some of the BEST drip coffee I've had. Their yogurt parfaits with fruit are also really fresh and delicious. I love that they're open till 10pm. Sometimes my fiance and I will stop in pretty late just to get some dessert. Great to have this place in the neighborhood!

But far the best coffee in town. Pastries are always so yummy and fresh they can't be beat. I love the chai latte (I get mine with almond or Coco milk). My fave sweets are the brownies. They are decadent and rich bars of chocolate heaven. I can come here alone or to meet with friends or family.  Sometimes I come with my daughter for a treat. Check them out.

Close to the office. Way Cheaper than SBux!...

There have never been more than 2 people in line when I come in, so I am not sure how to rate the speed of service. The music playing in the background is nice. Oh, I almost forgot! The Best thing about Echo is that the 'ToGo' cups do not leak all over my work shirt!!!

It's always nice to stumble across a locally owned coffeeshop, and this one is no exception. Not only that, but it's all organic, a place after my own Colorado hippie heart. And if that wasn't enough, they have cupcakes!

Their chai was delicious (although presweetened, so those of you who like to put in your own agave are out of luck), and my partner enjoyed her iced latte, saying it tasted fresh. The made-there coffee cake was incredibly messy, but also incredibly delicious.

I like the decor; great artwork, soothing colors, some chairs/tables and some comfy chairs, and great music that we really enjoyed. I love the easy to access free wireless as well. I can't stand places that charge at this point in my life. I'm no trendy college student.

Prices are good for drinks, but seem a little high for the food items, especially the wraps.  The owner was super nice, but didn't seem to "get it" when I spoke to him about gender neutral bathrooms, which are of importance to me, my partner, and queer friendly groups I would love to have meet here in the future.  I'm hoping he'll change the two single stall rooms to be gender neutral -- eliminate lines, and make everyone feel welcome.

I'll be back, for sure. I have to try the cupcakes!

Fast and reliable WiFi, great coffee, comfortable chairs and tables.

This is my favorite coffee shop in the valley.

Love it.
Echo coffee is the best in Scottsdale! The atmosphere is great and the baristas are really nice. I like their scones a lot too! I'd highly recommend it.

Quaint. Relaxed. Casual. I wish this review was for my dentist but it's not. Great place to chill with compadres, take in a book or do some computer work. Free WiFi so, "WiFi" not? See what I did there? Ahem. Personally, I recommend any of the iced beverages because they are tasty. The hot stuff is pretty freaking satisfying as well. Must stop in sometime. If I'm in there, you can make fun of my hair.

The third time was the charm! I am from Seattle and I admit, I am a coffee snob. I am always looking for the local coffee shop with a great latte (not Starbucks!). Being in the area for 3 days, I tried 3 local shops. This was by far the best! When ordering a coffee "for here" I expect it to be in a ceramic mug...this was! The latte was the right temperature and the foam was perfect....velvety, and most importantly, the flavor was great! They roast their own beans and even their decaf (which my husband had) was good. I like that they offer pour over coffee and a pots of French Press. The atmosphere was nice with abundant local art work on the walls. This should definitely be the local favorite!

I'm new to Scottsdale and have been working from home (which means out of coffee shops) the last couple of weeks--and have been pleasantly surprised by all the great indie options in Old Town (Sola, Winfield's). Echo is no exception.

Equally great atmosphere for doing work or just hanging out, Echo has the added bonus of a made-to-order lunch menu. To top it off, my americano came with a tiny little bite-sized sugar cookie, just enough to satisfy my afternoon sweets craving. I'm sold.

While spending the weekend in Scottsdale, we attempted to try as many coffee places as possible (at least until we were overloaded on caffeine - 5 doubles is pushing my limit in a 24 hour period....).

The store is very clean, new, and modern.  They've got a La Marzocco Linea and a serious group of grinders - Mazzer Robur, Elecktra Nina, and Two Compak K10s - they mean business. 

I had a double espresso - described as a Papua New Guinea single origin with citrus and berry flavors.  It was pulled more of a traditional volume at 2oz+, but I was getting a little sweetness with some earthy flavors.  They have a couple of espresso bean options, so trying others might have found one a little more to my liking. My dad had a latte, which was pretty good - maybe the coffee works better in milk.

The barista was friendly and open to talk about the coffee, which was nice.  They roast on site, which is a plus too.  The place has a lot of potential, so it will be interesting to see what they do in the future.

Just moved across the street and this place is a gem! I came in around 11:15am on a Tues and the place was full but not packed. They brew REAL COFFEE, the kind that you can drink black, no sugar. I got a simple drip, nothing added and it was very flavorful. I also found that they have a selection of gluten free baked goods, yayyy! I tried the peanut butter chocolate chip oat bar and it was delicious! They have a great selection of drinks and snacks, with healthy and organic choices. Cute spot, very friendly and personable staff. Rare to find a coffee spot like this in Scottsdale. Reminded me of a small town coffee shop in Colorado, so I will definitely be back again soon, probably tomorrow!!

Sweet little coffee shop, I had the BEST dirty chai tea, I've ever had. You know its good when your wife is drinking half of it! They must have some awesome WIFI, I was the only one without a laptop in here.  THUMBS UP!!
Fantastic coffee! The owner is super nice and the environment is great. Wish it was in Ahwatukee.

Great little coffee shop.  They "hand" brew their coffee one cup at a time and the results are exceptional tasting coffee!   They make wonderful banana nut bread.
